author: By Kara Elder
title: Last chance to try Loudoun County’s Farm-to-Fork specialties
text:
Farm-to-Fork Loudoun highlights Loudoun County restaurants, farms and wineries including Bluemont Vineyard, pictured here. (Catoctin Photography) By Kara Elder July 29 at 7:00 AM THURSDAY FARM-TO-FORK LOUDOUN: Through Aug. 2, participating Loudoun County restaurants feature special menus using primarily locally sourced food and wine. www.farmtoforkloudoun.com .
FRIDAY COOKING DEMO AND DINNER: Interactive class featuring American Southern food. 6:30-9 p.m. $79, not including tax and gratuity. Open Kitchen, 7115 Leesburg Pike, Falls Church. 703-942-8148. openkitchen-dcmetro.com .
SATURDAY WINEYARDS: Washington City Paper hosts a wine festival with live music, food vendors and unlimited samples from more than 20 wineries. 1-5 p.m. $35. The Yards, 301 Water St. SE. wapo.st/wineyards2015 .
SUNDAY WINE TASTING: A fundraiser to support the historic Chapman-Beverley Mill. Barbecue and wood-fired pizza also available to purchase. 1-5 p.m. $25. Barrel Oak Winery, 3623 Grove Lane, Delaplane. 540-253-5888. chapmansmill.org/events .
RESERVE NOW AUG. 8
CRAB AND WINE FEAST: The third annual all-you-can-eat dinner paired with wine and music. Ticket sales end August 6. 6-9 p.m. $75. Lost Creek Vineyards and Winery, 43277 Spinks Ferry Rd., Leesburg. 703-443-9836. lcwcrabfeast3.eventbrite.com .
— Kara Elder
